revised_title: Obituary Notices of Albin Haller and Francis Robert Japp
tldr: This article is an obituary for two notable chemists, Albin Haller and Francis Robert Japp. Haller was a pioneer in the chemistry of camphor and introduced the use of sodamide, a valuable reagent in organic chemistry. Japp was a prominent member of the Chemical Society and a skilled researcher. Both chemists made significant contributions to the field of chemistry and inspired future generations of chemists.
